definitions.definition: the action of a person or thing that taps.
draw liquid through the tap or spout of (a cask, barrel, or other container).
examples: bragging of tests they had aced and kegs they had tapped

definitions.definition: draw (liquid) from a cask, barrel, or other container.
examples: the butlers were tapping new ale

definitions.definition: connect a device to (a telephone) so that conversation can be listened to secretly.
examples: the telephones were tapped by the state security police
he considered whom he could tap for information

definitions.definition: exploit or draw a supply from (a resource).
examples: clients from industry seeking to tap Philadelphia's resources of expertise
synonyms: turn to account "the resources were to be tapped for our benefit"

definitions.definition: draw sap from (a tree) by cutting into it.
cut a thread in (something) to accept a screw.
strike (someone or something) with a quick light blow or blows.
examples: one of my staff tapped me on the shoulder
synonyms: drum More"she tapped on the door"pat
dig "Dad tapped me on the knee"knock
drumming "a sharp tap at the door"

definitions.definition: strike (something) against something else with a quick light blow or blows.
examples: Gloria was tapping her feet in time to the music

definitions.definition: produce (a rhythm) with a series of quick light blows on a surface.
examples: drums that tapped out a rumba beat

definitions.definition: write or enter (something) using a keyboard or keypad.
examples: he tapped out a few words on the keyboard

definitions.definition: designate or select (someone) for a task or honor, especially membership in an organization or committee.
examples: he had been tapped earlier to serve in Costa Rica
